column5: Hey guys, Im looking for a good guide to target Simcoe laker and whitefish. Any suggestions?  Thanks
Sir fish alot  Hes on the board.  Just scroll down to see Steves post.  I,ll save ya the bother  http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=50336
i haven't used him, but sir fish a lot (steve) is a young, enthusiastic guide who is well respected on this page.  i'd give him a whirl!  make sure you post a report after you go!
Yep. Steve will put you on fish.  Def get some lakers with him.  I hired him before.  Ryan guides as well. (can't remember his screen name)

Ryan Hare aka Troutguy  [email protected]  Both Steve and Ryan are capable guides on Simcoe.  Not sure about the travel situation...very slushy right now on the lake, tough on ATVs...I was out Wed -- good fishing, but slow going and very wet, especially around cracks...

Hey thanks for the recommendations guys, I'll definitely do my best to put you on fish.  Ryan's screen name is troutguy, and as with everything, I recommend shopping around.  Ryan is also an excellent choice, you can see his site @ www.wepoundemfishing.com or the link to my site is below.  Hope you're on fish whichever route you choose!
Thanks Steve  You have any room for 2 guys on sunday?
I do. Shoot me an email at [email protected] or give me a call @ 705-790-1643
Hey Hawk Eye  For Guide Service on Simcoe for Lakers and Whities  Either Ryan (TroutGuy)  or  Steve (Steverowbatham)  For Perch Rick (Whitie, SimcoeFishingAdventures)   Have Fun Rick
went with Sirfishalot yesterday, nobody was on the fish but us...... on ice at 11 off at 3pm bagged a 6lbs white and 6.5lbs laker pic to prove
I didn't know guide service was available on the ice at Simcoe...NICE...what do you guys charge ?  Bob
Iceguidez  Not sure if Don is still in the game but he'd be worth checking out.
Steve all the way.  Took the three youngsters out with him last year, great patience, and, he knows his lakers.  Good luck
